metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12026 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: During the spawning of a malicious Passenger-managed application, SpawningKit in Phusion Passenger 5.3.x before 5.3.2 allows such applications to replace key files or directories in the spawning communication directory with symlinks. This then could result in arbitrary reads and writes, which in turn can result in information disclosure and privilege escalation.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> xenial, bionic, focal and impish have version 5.0.x and are not affected because the issue was introduced in 5.3.0, with a major overhaul in SpawningKit.

criterions.comment: ruby-passenger: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
